name: N-methyl-2-[2-(2-methylphenyl)-2-oxoethyl]-N-phenylbenzamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2481
Reason: 2-[2-(2-methylphenyl)-2-oxoethyl]-N-phenylbenzamide has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. Starting with the base unit of benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C, we have substantial structural components to consider. The methyl group adds approximately +10 °C due to increased molecular weight and rigidity. The phenyl group introduces a rigid structure and enhances pi-stacking interactions, estimated at around +20 °C. The oxo group introduces a carbonyl functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and rigidify the structure, estimated at around +10 °C. The methylene bridge introduces a rigid structure and reduces the symmetry, estimated at around +5 °C. The presence of two phenyl groups can also contribute to the melting point, estimated at around +20 °C each.
